intro: Crossostylis banksiana, commonly known as the Banksia crossostylis, is a species of flowering plant in the Proteaceae family. It is native to the south-western region of Western Australia, where it typically grows in sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its distinctive cylindrical inflorescence, which consists of numerous yellow to orange flowers. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Crossostylis banksiana is adapted to dry, nutrient-poor environments and plays an important role in the local ecosystem.
